title: How to get Downloads to my preffered location
content: In the last few versions of Firefox the "Always ask you where to save files" does not work properly. Sometimes it asks, sometimes it automatically downloads. The majority of items I download are in PDF. Some I am asked & put on desktop to move later while some are automatically sent to Downloads folder. In Help, it says to go to Settings > General > Applications to get this to happen but under PDF I have it set to "Always ask". And Firefox is not doing this. Will this be fixed in future versions? There seem to be a lot of people that have this problem, which is basically creating work. I understand it only takes seconds to get them but over the course of time it's not efficient. I've been using Firefox for years & do not always agree with some of the changes but this one is really frustrating because it is not consistent. I only want to be able to have the where to/save as box show up when I attempt to download a PDF. Any other or real suggestions would be appreciated. Thank you, JF

title: SSL_ERROR_BAD_CERT_DOMAIN
content:
Hello,

When I open a email which contains an url like https://link.domain.com using sendgrid.com's service, I get a SSL_ERROR_BAD_CERT_DOMAIN error.

An example of such an url is https://link.intersport.fi. The domain starting with link is a service provided by sendgrid.com to be used in email advertising.

The issue is not specific to intersport.fi but to any domain using sendgrid's link service.

The strange thing is that Chrome and Edge are totally happy with link.domain.extension.

What is your take on this?

Best Regards, Thomas

title: Browser aborts the POST request exactly after 60 seconds.
content:
Hi.

we send a POST query in our web application, but this is aborted exactly after 60 seconds in Firefox. Our timeout for this query is set to 5 minutes. However, this error does not happen in other browsers! We also use ServiceWorker. The error "NS_ERROR_DOM_ABORT_ERR" is displayed in developer tools.

We have also changed all the timeout settings under about:config. But without success!

What do we have to do so that the query doesn't always abort after 60 seconds?

Thank you and best regards
creator: kalender.hisir

title: Why do cookies persist after clicking "Clear Data"?
content:
Hi Mozilla community,

The Developer Tools -> Storage -> Cookies pane shows cookies currently being stored by Firefox.

If I close my browser, these cookies are automatically deleted. However, if I follow the steps on [1], the cookies are still there, and don't get deleted. *Why?*

Thanks in advance!

Steps to reproduce: 

- Start a new Firefox session - Open Developer Tools -> Storage -> Cookies and see that the list is empty - Go to youtube.com and click Accept All on the cookies popup - Developer Tools -> Storage -> Cookies now shows a cookie from YouTube, as per the attached screenshot - Go to Settings->Privacy & Security->Cookies and Site Data -> Clear Data -> Clear - Go back to Developer Tools -> Storage -> Cookies and click on the refresh icon - The YouTube cookie is still there - However either of the following actions will correctly delete this cookie:

1) closing firefox (with Always Use Private Browsing Mode enabled) 2) manually deleting the cookie from the list in Developer Tools -> Storage -> Cookies


[1] https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/clear-cookies-and-site-data-firefox
creator: tomchopin

title: Input languages
content: In the previous versions of Firefox, when selecting a language of input, all the other languages were unselected. This was a much better option than today's, where they remain selected, allowing to check in several languages simultaneously. The problem with that is that when a word exists in both languages with a small difference (accent, two letters reversed or something like that), if there is a spelling mistake, it may not appear. In the example below, "defense" should be with an accent: "défense".

title: Mancato accesso al sito scribd.com
content:
Sia su desktop che su android, Firefox non apre il sito scribd.com dando il messaggio di errore "Impossibile contattare il server"; cliccando sull'icona accanto all'indirizzo web, compare un pop-up che riporta: "La connessione con questo sito non è sicura". Cliccando poi sulle ulteriori informazioni compare un'altro pop-up da cui pare che il sito non supporti la connessione crittata (per maggiori dettagli vedi le immagini allegate). Con Microsoft Edge invece non ho il minimo problema e posso accedere al sito normalmente con connessione crittata (vedi ultima immagine). Ho già provveduto a modificare i parametri di IPv6 e prefetch del dns secondo quanto consigliato dalla pagina di aiuto "I siti web vengono caricati con altri programmi ma non con Firefox" così come ho provato l'avvio in modalità provvisoria ma in entrambi i casi senza risultato. Il problema è particolarmente seccante perché su android anche l'app (che probabilmente si appoggia al browser predefinito ovvero Firefox) segnala erroneamente che non sono connesso ad internet. Resto in attesa di una soluzione, grazie.

PS: per cortesia evitate di fare riferimento alle pagine di aiuto perché le ho già consultate senza risultato
creator: antonio.chiari

title: Whatsapp Web Hesap Otomatik Açılmıyor
content:
Merhaba,

Whatsapp Web'e girişte sıkıntı yaşıyorum. Whatsapp hesabım açık kalması gerektiği halde tarayıcıyı her kapatıp açtığımda bağlantım kopuyor ve "lütfen bilgisayarınızın internet bağlantısını kontrol edin" benzeri bir mesaj alıyorum, internet kesinlikle bağlı olduğu halde. Tarayıcıyı tekrar kapatıp açtığımda bu sefer giriş yapmak için tekrar karekod taramamı istiyor. Benzer bir soruna verilen cevaptan çerez ve geçmiş ayarlarımı kontrol ettim, ayarların hepsi olması gerektiği gibi. Çerezler silinmiyor ve geçmiş kaydediliyor. Bir türlü hesabın açık kalmasını sağlayamıyorum.

Son birkaç gündür 2 ayrı cihazda bu problemi yaşıyorum.

Yardımcı olabilirseniz çok mutlu olacağım. Teşekkürler.

title: A ServiceWorker passed a promise to FetchEvent.respondWith() that resolved with non-Response value ‘undefined’.
content:
Hey there,

For the last 2 days I have been experiencing issues with soundcloud and linear.

After looking into the console I noticed that there are a lot of errors, and they look the same.

Failed to load ‘https://a-v2.sndcdn.com/assets/1-c3c6190a.js’. A ServiceWorker passed a promise to FetchEvent.respondWith() that resolved with non-Response value ‘undefined’.

I installed https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/block-website/ about that time, but I tried to disable the extension, it did not help. I also tried troubleshoot mode, did not help either.

Soundcloud works in a private window with all extensions enabled, even block-website.

Any ideas?

Thank you
creator: bence1204
